Package XXLChess

Class Piece

java.lang.Object
XXLChess.GameObject
XXLChess.Piece
Direct Known Subclasses:
Amazon, Archbishop, Bishop, Camel, Chancellor, Guard, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public abstract class Piece extends GameObject
Abtract class representing a piece.

  • Constructor Details

    • Piece

      public Piece(float x, float y, String code, Square curSquare)
      Constructs a new piece.
      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate of the piece.
      y - the y coordinate of the piece.
      code - the unique identifier for each piece.
      curSquare - the square which the piece belongs to initially.

  • Method Details

    • setMoveStat

      public static void setMoveStat(double movementSpeed, int movementTime, int pawnDirection)
      Setup the movement stats.
      Parameters:
      movementSpeed - the default movement speed.
      movementTime - the maximum movement time.
      pawnDirection - the direction of pawn for each side.

    • setSprite

      public void setSprite(processing.core.PApplet app)
      Sets the object's sprite.
      Parameters:
      app - is the main application.

      public void updatePreLegalMoves(Board curBoard)
      Get the prelegal move of a piece.
      Parameters:
      curBoard - the board which all pieces are on.

    • updateLegalMove

      public void updateLegalMove(Board curBoard)
      From the prelegal moves, filter out the illegal moves.
      Parameters:
      curBoard - the board which all pieces are on.

    • setDestination

      public void setDestination(Square target)
      Set the destination square of that the piece is going to move to.
      Parameters:
      target - the destination square.

    • getMoveFromSquare

      public Move getMoveFromSquare(Square s, boolean legal)
      Get the move that have the particular destination square.
      Parameters:
      s - the destination square.
      legal - the flag indicating whether the list of move the function taking from is legal or prelegal.
      Returns:
      the move that have the particular destination square, or null if no such move.
